alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Clark; Delaware; Fairfield; Franklin; Hocking; Licking; Logan; Madison; Pickaway; Union (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 11:14AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...SCATTERED HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS IN CENTRAL OHIO INTO EARLY AFTERNOON... Scattered snow showers...a few of them moderate to heavy intensity...will continue to drift through central Ohio into early afternoon. Warm pavement temperatures will keep roads mainly just wet, but rapid visibility changes below a half mile are possible for motorists moving at highway speed. Some ice pellets or graupel is also possible. The isolated nature of the showers, should keep impacts at any one location brief and localized. HAZARD...Rapidly changing visibility. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Driving conditions may change quickly. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Springfield, Newark, Dublin, Lancaster, Westerville, Reynoldsburg, Grove City, Delaware, Upper Arlington, Gahanna, Hilliard, Marysville, Pickerington, Worthington, Circleville, Bexley, Urbana, Heath and London. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 60 and 142, and near mile marker 144. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 84 and 138.
info.instruction: Exercise extra caution while traveling. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
